data.title: 2024 Idaho State Bar Annual Meeting
data.meta_description: To promote high standards of professional conduct and to aid in the advancement of the administration of justice.
data.text:
Annual Meeting Registration

In-Person attendance will be available for all courses and events.

Webcast attendance will only be available for select CLE courses.

All CLE courses will be recorded and available for on-demand purchase beginning in August 2024.

You can opt to select just a few CLEs to attend on either day by selecting the à la carte method of registration.

The registration fee for each CLE is $60.

For Law Students, the registration fee is $15 per CLE.

Attendees can also save money by bundling CLEs.

Bundle Options

Award Programs and Social Events Schedule

Please note that in an effort to get a precise count on the number of people attending each event, you must register beforehand.

All social and award events are ticketed separately and are not included with registration for CLE courses.

All events will be held at JUMP in Boise.

Distinguished Lawyer, Distinguished Jurist and Outstanding Young Lawyer Reception & Awards Ceremony

Wednesday Evening, July 17th – 5:00 pm

$45 per person

Service Awards and Idaho Law Foundation Annual Meeting Luncheon

Thursday Afternoon, July 18th – 12:00 pm

$35 per person

Milestone Celebration Reception: Celebrating 70, 65, 60, 50, 40 and 25 Years of Admission

Thursday Evening, July 18th – 5:00 pm

$35 per person

Networking BBQ Lunch – Section of the Year and the Passing of the Gavel

Friday Afternoon, July 19th – 12:00 pm

$35 per person

Distinguished Lawyer, Distinguished Jurist and Outstanding Young Lawyer Awards Reception and Ceremony

Wednesday Evening, July 17th – 5:00 pm

Jack’s Urban Meeting Place – Pioneer Room

Distinguished Lawyer Honorees

Distinguished Jurist Honoree

Outstanding Young Lawyer Honoree

Idaho State Bar/Idaho Law Foundation Service Awards

We will be honoring the following members of the Idaho State Bar during the Service Awards Luncheon on Thursday, July 18th at 12:00 pm at JUMP – Pioneer Room.

Honoring those admitted to the Bar in 1984.

25-Year Attorneys

Idaho State Bar Section of the Year

We will also be honoring the be honoring the Idaho State Bar Taxation, Probate, and Trust Law Section as the Section of the Year during the Networking BBQ and Awards Luncheon on Friday, July 19th at 12:00 pm at JUMP in Boise.

2024 Annual Meeting Scholarships Available – Deadline June 3

The Idaho State Bar is offering a limited number of scholarships to the 2024 Annual Meeting, July 17-19, at JUMP in Boise. The scholarships will include full registration, tickets to the social events and per diem up to $100 per day for travel and lodging. The scholarships are designed to provide assistance to those attorneys who, due to financial or professional circumstances, would otherwise be unable to attend.

To apply for scholarship, please fill out this 2024 Annual Meeting Scholarship Request Form. If you have any questions, please contact the ISB Commissioner who represents your judicial district or the ISB Program and Legal Education Director Teresa Baker.

The Fourth District Bar, the Sixth District Bar and the Idaho Women Lawyers are also providing several scholarships. If you are a member of any of these organizations and would like to apply for one of their scholarships, please use the same Scholarship Request form and the applications will be forward to the District Bar officers for their review.

Deadline for scholarship requests is Thursday, June 3, 2024.

Please use the links below if you only wish to register for the webcast options for the 2024 Annual Meeting.

Bundles:

There is only one CLE per time slot that will be webcast.* Click on the bundle below that you would like to purchase for attending via webcast.

Individual Course Registration:

There is only one CLE per time slot that will be webcast.* You may also register for each CLE individually, just click on the titles below.

The Challenges of Pre-Trial Publicity

Media Relations and Obstacles When Your Case Makes National News

Deposition Strategies

Not Like on TV: Ethics in Law Dramas

New Developments in Administrative Hearings in Idaho

The Last Resort: Methods and Issues Regarding Debt Collection

Lessons from the Bench

*The CLEs that are not webcast will be recorded and available for on-demand purchase beginning in August.

Lodging

Hotel 43 is offering attendees of the Annual Meeting a discounted rate of $209/night plus tax. To take advantage of this offer, please book using this link or by calling Hotel 43 at 208-342-4622. Mention the Idaho State Bar. Rooms must be booked by Friday, June 14, 2024.

There are a limited number of rooms available at the discounted rate.

Parking Information for JUMP

Paid parking is available on the 3rd and 4th levels of the JUMP parking garage or in Simplot’s below ground parking garage, both accessible from the Myrtle Street entrance located between 11th and 9th Streets. Please note, the below ground parking garage is only available after 4PM until 6AM on weekdays and all day on weekends. Credit/debit cards accepted only.

Parking Garage Rates are $3/hr. with a $15 daily max. .

Public parking in the gravel lot at Myrtle & 11th St. is $5 per day plus a $.50 processing fee and is paid in advance via the phone app ParkMobile. Make sure you are parking in a proper space and centered on the block. See the map below.

Please view the JUMP Building Map to locate accessible parking spaces or call 208.639.6610 for additional information.
